III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
This agency is located on the first floor of a single-family home located at 1653 Herrick
NE, in Grand Rapids. It consists of a meeting room and an equipped office with
sufficient space for 3 people to work. There is also a locking, fireproof file cabinet for
storage of records.
B. Program Description
This agency intends to write home studies for adoptive parents who are interested in
international adoption. The initial focus of the program will be on Chinese adoptions.
The agency has a working relationship with the Chinese Children Adoption International
in Centennial, Colorado.
The agency also intends to provide post placement supervision as required by Chinese
law.
Families Through Adoption intends to maintain a client base through direct referrals
from Chinese Children Adoption International. The Agency’s contract with adoptive
families specifies that while the family contracts with Families Through Adoption for a
home study and / or required post adoption services and supervision, Families Through
Adoption is not involved in the actual foreign adoption process and requires the family to
enter into a separate contract with an international adoption program such as Chinese
Children Adoption International for the placement and adoption of the child.
Charlene Lanning, the chief administrator of Families Through Adoption, is qualified for
this position and has not yet hired staff.
The policies, procedures, and forms of this agency have been reviewed and meet
licensing rules.
2

C. Rule/Statutory Violations
This agency is found to be in compliance with Child Placing Agency licensing rules.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that Families Through Adoption be issued a provisional license to
evaluate applicants for adoption and to supervise children placed with adoptive
parents.
